isasim

Class Memory

    • Constructor Detail

      • Memory

        public Memory(int capacity,
              int length,
              java.lang.String filename,
              Register addrRegister)
        Memory object constructor.

        The memory object will read 'words' from a file line by line, and fill in this objects data to the specified capacity.

        If the input file has more lines than the specified memory capacity, the excess memory words will be skipped.

        If the input file has less lines than the specified capacity, the remaining memory locations will be filled with empty words (0)

        If any line in the file that has less than a word length of characters, that word will be prepadded with '0' to meet the desired length

        The input of addressing to a Memory object will be limited to the assigned register

        Parameters:
        capacity - overall size of this Memory object
        length - word size for this Memory object
        filename - input file to initialize the data
        addrRegister - the Register to use for addressing

    • Method Detail

      • writeToMem

        public void writeToMem()
        Store the current contents of this object. This method will write the contents of the current memory data to the file associated with this object in order to maintain the memory values between runs of the simulator.

      • readFromMem

        public void readFromMem()
        Retrieve the data stored for this memory. This method will update this objects current data to the data that is stored in the data file associated with this object.

      • read

        public java.lang.String read()
        Retrieve a data word from this object. This method will provide the data value stored in this object at the location indicated by the addressing register associated with this object.
        Returns:
        the data string stored at Memory[register.value]

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String dataIn)
        Update this object's memory. This method will write the provided data to the location indicated by the addressing register associated with this object.
        Parameters:
        dataIn - the data to be written
